questions.question: What is the purpose of the PasswordValidator interface?
answers: To validate passwords based on specific criteria.
To create a database of user credentials.

questions.question: What does the ValidationResult record represent?
answers: The criteria used to validate passwords.
The result of password validation, including status and an optional message.

questions.question: Which component is responsible for dynamically loading and testing password validators?
Which of the following must be included in the team's deliverables?
answers: A JAR file containing the implementation.
A pom.xml file with <scm> and <developers> sections.
A Word document describing validation criteria.

questions.question: What must the <developers> section in the pom.xml file contain?
answers: A list of GitHub IDs of the students involved in the project.
The name of the password validation team.
The Java version used in the implementation.

questions.question: Where must the JAR file and pom.xml be pushed?
answers: To the student's personal GitHub repository.

questions.question: Which section of the pom.xml file specifies where the project sources are hosted?
What format is NOT allowed for the README file describing validation criteria?
What does the <distributionManagement> section in the pom.xml specify?
answers: The Maven repository to which artifacts will be published.
The developers who contributed to the project.
